meanings.sent1: The phosphores on the wall glowed softly in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the phosphores under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the phosphores on their glow-in-the-dark stickers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like phosphores in the night.
meanings.sent5: The forest was filled with tiny phosphores, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To emit light without combustion or perceptible heat.
meanings.sent1: The fireflies phosphores gently in the summer evening.
meanings.sent2: The glow stick phosphores brightly in the concert crowd.
meanings.sent3: The nightlight phosphores all night, keeping the room softly lit.
meanings.sent4: His eyes phosphores with excitement as he talked about his favorite subject.
meanings.sent5: The stars phosphores in the sky, creating a beautiful display.
